sentence: Home improvement warehouse operator The Home Depot, Inc. ( HD ) on Tuesday posted better-than-expected fourth quarter earnings and raised its dividend payout by 6%.
The Atlanta-based company reported fourth quarter net income of $587 million, or 36 cents per share, compared with $342 million, or 20 cents per share, in the year-ago period.
Revenue rose 4% from last year to $15.13 billion.
On average, Wall Street analysts expected a smaller profit of 31 cents per share, on lower revenue of $14.81 billion.
Looking ahead, Home Depot raised its full-year 2011 profit forecast.
It now expects 2011 profit to rise 9.5%, up from prior guidance for a 7% to 9% increase.
The company also boosted its quarterly dividend payout by 6%, to 25 cents per share.
The new dividend will be paid on March 24 to shareholders of record as of March 10.
Shares of Home Depot ( HD ) will now have a 2.60% dividend yield, based on the higher dividend payout and Friday's closing stock price of $38.48.
The stock has technical support in the $34-$36 price area.
If the shares can continue the recent momentum, we see overhead resistance around the $40-$41 price levels.
The Home Depot, Inc. ( HD ) is not recommended at this time, holding a Dividend.com DARSâ„¢ Rating of 3.4 out of 5 stars.
